title: Commission Regulation (EEC) No 671/84 of 15 March 1984 on applications for the financing of aids granted by Member States to producers' organizations in the fishery products sector
header:
COMMISSION  REGULATION (EEC) No 671/84
of 15 March 1984
on applications for the financing of aids granted by Member States to producers' organizations in the fishery products sector
THE COMMISSION OF THE EUROPEAN
COMMUNITIES
main_body:
1. The applications for financing referred to in Article 10 (1) of Regulation (EEC) No 3140/82 must be submitted in the form of the tables shown in the Annexes.
2. The Member States shall communicate to the Commission, along with their first application for financing, the texts of the national provisions relating to implementation and controls and of the relevant administrative instructions, together with any forms or other documents relating to the administration of the aid.

The Member States shall keep at the Commission's disposal, in respect of each beneficiary and for a period of three years after the final financing has taken place, all the supporting documents of authenticated copies thereof which are in their possession and on the basis of which the decision was taken to grant the aid provided for in Article 6 of Regulation (EEC) No 3796/81.

This Regulation shall enter into force on the third day following its publication in the Official Journal of the European Communities.
This Regulation shall be binding in its entirety and directly applicable in all Member States.

1. How does the producers' organization intend to ensure that fishing is carried out along rational lines and that conditions for the sale of products are improved?
2. What provision is made in the charter for satisfying the requirement that all products in respect of which producers hold membership must be disposed of through the organization and how is this applied in practice?
3. Where appropriate: what are the products and the quantities which member producers are authorized by the producers' organization to market themselves and what pre-established common rules apply in this case?
4. What rules governing production and marketing are applied by the producers' organization?
5. By what specific means does the producers' organization intend to ensure compliance with the minimum production and marketing rules throughout the fishing year?
6. Supply information that will confirm that the producers' organization does not hold a dominant position on the common market, unless such a position is necessary for the pursuit of the objectives of Article 39 of the Treaty.
7. Are there in the same area other organizations which have already been recognized and whose activities relate to the same products or similar products? If so, give the names, the addresses and the operating areas of such other organizations. Indicate to what extent the information of the producers' organization brings about, by greater rationalization of fishing activities on the basis of catch plans and by improved concentration of supplies of the products landed by its members, an improvement in production and marketing structures as compared with the existing situation (2).
8. If the producers' organization is formed from pre-existing organizations, give the names and addresses of the latter.
9. How was the organization informed of the Community contribution towards the financing of the aid?
(1) Continuous numbering from one year to the next.
(2) To be answered only in respect of producers' organizations in receipt of the aids provided for in Article 6 (2) (b) of Regulation (EEC) No 3796/81 (OJ No L 379, 31. 12. 1981, p. 1).
